description: Variation of condition 3 (hours of opening) of planning permission 2015/0933 dated 27/07/2015. The effect of variation would be to amend the opening hours to 12:00-01:00 Sunday to Wednesday,  12:00-02:00 Thursday to Friday and 12:00-03:00 on Saturday.
decision_conditions: <p>Within 3 months of the date of this permission, a Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall set out measures to ensure that the extended opening hours do not result in harm to residential amenity and must include, but not be limited to:&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>- Procedures to minimise noise and disturbance upon closing, including staff intervention to prevent loitering and noise spillover onto residential streets.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>- Steps to address any instances of anti-social behaviour, including engagement with local policing teams if necessary.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>- Details of staffing, security personnel, CCTV coverage, and other measures to prevent anti-social behaviour.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>The approved Management Plan shall be fully implemented and adhered to at all times thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: To ensure the extended opening hours do not result in unacceptable harm to the residential amenity of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with Hackney Local Plan Policy LP2 (Development and Amenity).</p>

<p>The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details. </p><p>REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.</p>

<p>Within 3 months of the date of this permission, detailed plans, specifications, and a maintenance regime for the ventilation equipment, including measures to alleviate noise, vibration, fumes, and odours (incorporating active carbon filters, silencer(s), and anti-vibration mountings), shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>The approved system shall be installed in full accordance with the approved plans and specifications and shall thereafter be permanently maintained in accordance with the approved specifications and maintenance regime.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>Noise levels generated by any plant and equipment shall not increase the existing general background noise levels at 1 metre from the plant or equipment or at the nearest residential fa√ßade (in dBA 10 L90 for 5 minutes). This equates to 10 dBA below existing background noise levels for the particular location in question, with noise levels tested on completion.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area in general, in accordance with Hackney Local Plan Policy LP2 (Development and Amenity).</p>
